pages.text: post Community Service toolbar Share: Email Print post intro Old Town Trolley Tours of St. Augustine is proud to give back to our community where we live, work & play. post options post content Old Town Trolley Supports Our Community and Many Other Worthy Causes. Historic Tours of America Endowed Scholarship in Hospitality and Tourism Management This scholarship was established to support first-generation students, students of color, or those demonstrating financial need, with a declared major in hospitality or tourism management. The endowment is generously matched 1:1 by the William R. Kenan, Jr. Charitable Trust, doubling the impact of each contribution to benefit deserving students. Investing In Kids – INK! Investing in Kids (INK!) is the sole direct support organization for the St. Johns County School District, providing innovative programs and classroom resources to close the literacy gap, improve graduation rates, and help all students reach their full potential. Historic Tours of America proudly supports INK! financially throughout the year with various fundraisers and contests, including the annual Jail Break 5K ‘Run for a Cause,’ scholarships, and performance opportunities for school bands, choirs, and a cappella groups. Additionally, we sponsor the annual county-wide Holiday Tree Decorating Contest, the St. Johns County School Calendar, and co-sponsor the St. Johns County Teacher of the Year banquet. International Board of Credentialing and Continuing Educational Standards All of Historic Tours of America’s St. Augustine tours and attractions have earned the designation of Certified Autism Centers. This certification ensures that our organization is fully equipped to better serve Guests with autism or other sensory sensitivities, enhancing the Guest experience for all. It also empowers our CAST with the confidence to handle various situations that may arise. All St. Augustine CASTmembers are required to complete autism training within their first 90 days of employment. In addition, leadership undergoes more in-depth certification to further their competency. HTA is leading the charge for the city of St. Augustine to one day be named a Certified Autism Friendly Destination. St. Johns County School District Life Work Transition Program The Life Work Transition Program is an outcome-driven post-secondary option designed for 18 to 22-year-old students with disabilities in the St. Johns County School District. These students have met all graduation requirements but have deferred receiving their diplomas to further develop essential skills for successful employment, social interactions, and independent living. Historic Tours of America provides these students with the opportunity to explore employment through various hands-on work experiences within our operations while integrating classroom learning. St. Johns County school staff assist students in setting individualized goals, identifying needs, and developing specific skill sets, helping to prepare them for vocational rehabilitation and adult services once their deferment period ends. Annual Martin Luther King Breakfast After the title sponsor withdrew, Historic Tours of America stepped in to support the annual commemorative breakfast. The sold-out event will now be held at the larger Renaissance Hotel downtown. The event honors the memory of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his pivotal role in the passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. Following the breakfast, hundreds will join a half-mile walk through the streets of St. Augustine to the Plaza de la Constitución, retracing the steps of the marches Dr. King led here during the Civil Rights Movement in the 1960s. facts facts toolbar Share: Email Print related articles related articles Up Up

post Reviews toolbar Share: Email Print post intro What Our Guests are Saying “An absolute must when one is new to a city and has no idea where to go and how to get there…” post options post content T.P., Portland, OR “We rode the Nashville trolley… Picked it up convenient to our hotel… “Cousin Debbie” was our guide/driver. She was exceptional with lots of details about what we were seeing and a marvelous sense of humor and story telling. We did the complete circuit with her and decided to continue with her again until we got to the Country Music Hall of Fame. She was the best tour guide we have had in years. A real Nashville highlight!” S.M., Fountain Valley, CA “Owen is an absolutely amazing guide!!!!! My colleague and I had a conference in Nashville in September and since neither of us had visited the city before, we decided a tour was a great place to start. We were lucky enough to step onto Owen’s trolley and immensely enjoyed his energy and knowledge of the city. We ended up staying on for the entire circuit just to listen to him…” B.B., Westfield, IN “…Your driver Trey made our whole Nashville trip a blast. He was so much fun. We laughed until we hurt; hard to believe a bus tour could be so much fun. You’ve got a winner in Trey, keep him if you can.” S.R. “We just enjoyed a fantastic tour of Nashville with our new cousin Debbie. She was very knowledgeable, funny and a superb host. So pleased to have toured with her. We are from Liverpool, England, which is famous for its comedians (and the Beatles) and she would be very welcome there! Thank you Debbie and Old Town Tours.” I.M., Caribou Marsh, NS “We took the Nashville Old Town Trolley Tour with Tater as our guide. Loved the tour and our guide. He was energetic, funny, and very knowledgeable as well as being kind and helpful. Would definitely return for a tour with Tater.” L.J. “My co-worker and I did the soul tour in Nashville. It was a wonderful experience from beginning to end! Janice was our guide and she was extremely engaging. Her love of the city and music was palpable. I believe our driver was Trevor… He was awesome as well. At the end of the tour, he offered to wait until our Uber arrived. Kudos to both and definitely 5 stars!” R.P., Big Lake, MN “Buck was the most knowledgeable tour guide for our trip around Nashville. He was entertaining and insightful. We were fortunate to have Buck lead us on our tour of Nashville. You will not be disappointed in the experience with Buck as your guide. Thank you so much!!” K.B., Batavia, IL “We traveled with a group of friends on the Nashville Evening Trolley Tour… Kerrie and our tour guide were fantastic on our tour. They were fun and energetic and made the entire 90 minutes entertaining and informative. Thank you for an amazing experience in a fabulous town!” K.Q., Indianapolis, IN “We had the BEST time on our Nashville Trolley with Drey. He taught us so much and also made us laugh numerous times. My kids (ages 12, 10, and 8) said that the trolley was the best part of our time in Nashville. We highly recommend the Trolley ride to anyone visiting Nashville and hope they can find a time when Drey is the guide.” T.M., Sterling, NY “We recently traveled to Nashville and took a day to enjoy your Trolley Service. We had a wonderful time. Our tour guides were great and our favorite was Big Cat. He was engaging and made us laugh. His jokes were hilarious. I have friends who will be traveling to Nashville in March and I have highly recommended your organization. Your buses are neat, clean and you employ some great staff who truly try to make the experience fun. I also would like to add that they were clear on the expectations of riding the trolley and Big Cat went above and beyond with explaining to passengers on the stops at the end of the day. I thought that information was so nice to ensure that passengers don’t become stranded and not have the explanation from the driver. We will go back to Nashville again and plan on using your service in the future. It was worth the money and honestly a good time was had by all. Thank you for this opportunity to share our thoughts. Have a wonderful day.” M.K., Rockville, MD “My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our tour of Nashville on the Old Town Trolley with Benji as our guide! He shared so much knowledge about the city with his guests! In addition, his personal adages about the city, added another level, and enriched the tour! Benji was smart, funny and engaging! His humor matched mine, so he kept me laughing and learning throughout! His driving was impressive too! So much traffic and obstacles to weave through. Benji is an asset to your team!” J.H., Tobermory, OH “My husband and I have just returned from Nashville and we used Old Town Trolley Tours to get around and we just have to say that your driver Jules, or Julie was our absolute favorite driver that day. She gave all the necessary information with a great dash of her own humor and personality that made the trip so fun! Her love of the city of Nashville shone through each stop on the tour! We had a blast with Jules!” R.B., Milton, MA “My family and I enjoyed a tour of Nashville last week. Dave was our driver/guide. Dave was spectacular or should I say “SPECTACULAR” in describing the sights and history of your vibrant city. His enthusiasm was palpable.,Dave should be getting the compensation of your CEO but just don’t take him off of his trolley!” L.D., Southside, TN “Please give acknowledgement to ZACH and his Crew. He was AWESOME. I stared to cry when he acknowledged the African American History of Nashville. His crew was soo Patient with my 90 Year Old Mom. I have traveled often, and this was the Best Tour I have experienced in a Long Time. Thank him and his crew personally for me if possible. My Husband and I will take the tour SOON, hope it’s with ZACH, HE ROCKS!!!” C.H., Mandan, ND “I wanted to take the time to express our gratitude, and give a HUGE shout out to a few folks on our tour of Nashville. To start out Dave our driver and guide was a blast. He was a wealth of knowledge and made the ride fun and interactive. Our next driver was Ryan who did a great job keeping us safe. Our guide was Jimbo, who also had the history down to a ‘T’. It was a great tour with a great staff and we will be sure to do it again the next time we are in Nashville.” K.B., Haw River, NC “Good evening. I just wanted to take a minute and let you know about one of your employees. Debbie represents your company well. While in Nashville this past weekend we took the trolley tour. We had great tour guides but the best employee was Debbie. She was never our guide, but we ran into her at Chicken Guy during her lunch break. Because of her shirt and extremely friendly personality we struck up a conversation with her. Even while on her break, she was extremely helpful and friendly. We had such a bond with her we stopped by on Friday just to say hey and check in with her. You are extremely lucky to have an employee that represents you so well on and off the clock. Thank you for the tour and please tell Debbie her Chicken Guy friends greatly appreciate her hospitality.” N.W., St. Louis, MO “This is to say how much we enjoyed our ride with you this past Saturday. A BIG shout out to driver Dave who was a delight (we toured with some other good drivers, but Dave is a GEM!). Your company is a great way to see and learn about the Nashville spots of interest and get little tidbits of memorable information. My husband is a Vandy grad, but it has been a long time since I’ve been to Nashville, and wow have things changed in the years since. Dave mentioned a great spot near our hotel in The Gulch – the Station Inn – and a big highlight was seeing a concert there, and we would have missed it without Dave’s recommendation. We’re grateful for your fun and entertaining service!” L.A., Alachua, FL “I was just wondering how I could personally thank our tour guide Joshua on our Nashville tour this evening. He was so amazing I am overwhelmed with how much I enjoyed his personality and welcoming attitude. I learned so much compared to other tours where I lose interest.” L.J., Clarksville, TN “We had out of state family with us and decided to take the Nashville tour with your company. We waited for our trolley at stop 1 and got on. We were all greeted by Tony from Wisconsin. He was a phenomenal tour guide. Had a great personality and made the tour experience fun and memorable for everyone on board. People kept getting on but people didn’t want to get off until he had made his last stop before they changed out the driver. The entire bus emptied too. He is a great addition to Nashville and your tour company. Thank you.” S.C., Crystal City, MO “Took my first trolley tour for my first trip to Nashville. Brian “with an I” gave the tour and he did a phenomenal job. I enjoyed your stories and knowledge of Nashville. There was never a dull moment and I am boggled at how well you can drive and maneuver that huge bus in such tight turns. I have referred your company and Brian to everyone I have told about my trip! Thank you!” C.M, Minnesotta “My mother and I recently visited Nashville, TN, for the first time. We purchased a two day pass for the Old Town Trolly Tours and were not disappointed. It was recommended that we experience the whole tour first to get accustomed to the city, which we did for our first day. Nelson, our tour guide, was amazing! He was very personable, knowledgeable, and great at keeping conversation going. His sense of humor kept us captivated and we enjoyed the whole experience. On day two we had the pleasure of meeting Sam. Sam picked us up at Stop 8. He was very informative and we learned new facts on this second tour. Sam was charming, funny, and also very knowledgable. Everyone we ran into – from the lady who helped us activate our tickets at stop one on Saturday (she has really awesome rhinestone sunglasses) to the gentleman at stop one who helped us on Sunday were great. We really appreciated being able to see Nashville in a way that was informative and beneficial for individuals who might be less mobile. Thanks for a great experience!” K.M., Vernon Hills, IL “Thank you very much for an excellent experience in Nashville! It was our first time there so the information we received on the tour was extremely helpful! Each guide had their own story and perspective on the city we now love so much! Each ride was on time and full of such valuable information it made our trip so much better than it would have been!  Although each guide was amazing, Gigi really did exceptionally well! Her suggestions for food, drink and shopping were on point! Exactly what we were looking for! Thank you for an awesome Nashville experience! We have been recommending the trolley to everyone headed your way! Thanks again!” W.M., East Syracuse, NY “Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by Tony, he asked our names, as well as our home towns. Tony then introduced us to the rest of the passengers on board and we felt welcomed with such a friendly atmosphere we had a fantastic start!… Our guide Tony was extremely good, very humorous (appreciate this!) and for that, he deserves a special thanks, we had a great day. Tony has such a warm personality and a highly motivated guide (recommendable!). I truly enjoyed the beautiful history of Nashville as well as the gorgeous scenery. Much appreciation and respect to Tony who does a great job; a true example of an excellent tour guide! Many thanks again and I recommend Tony to everyone!” C.B., Cincinnati, OH “This past weekend I had the privilege of taking a tour of Nashville with our driver and host T.J. Not only did he get us around the construction in the area but he was very insightful pointing out spots and attractions we wouldn’t have found on our own. He also had a great personality, tells really bad jokes and he loves his job and it showed!” J.D., Gallatin, TN “We had a great experience with the Old Town Trolley folks on our Night Tour. Bret, our tour guide, was wonderful. He kept the whole bus entertained, informed, singing and was great at guiding us where we were to go and keeping everyone included on our stops. Mike, our experienced driver who got us through tight spots, was always extending a hand, with a smile, whenever we got on and off the bus, which I really appreciated. We will defiantly use the Old Town Trolleys again. Thanks” M.J., Lancaster, PA “I wanted to leave a positive response regarding the night tour and tour guide we had. Our sales team was in Nashville last week for a meeting and as a group we took the night tour on Wednesday. The tour was amazing and Nashville is an awesome town. But what made the tour so great was our guide; I believe her name is Lindsay. Her knowledge of the town, music industry, and excitement and energy made the tour a fantastic evening for our team. Please make sure she is recognized; she is a great asset to your organization. Our bus driver Mike also did a great job navigating the city streets and was very cordial, helping everyone young and old on and off the bus.” A.C., Elkton, KY “…The Night tour and the hop on hop off tours are both very good!! Sherri Lee was our night tour lady and Rusty the driver; both very helpful and polite. Chris, the day driver, was awesome and fun; both tours were Amazing!! We hated to see Chris get off to change drivers but understood. The history that you get is Great!!! very clean and tasteful tours; have already recommended to several people… Great job; prices are affordable and deals Great!!!” R.L. “We loved this tour!!! Perfect combo of comedy, history, views, music, and fun! Loved seeing the lights at night. Wonderful tour guide Sherri Lee and bus driver rusty. They worked well with each other and involved us in the comedy/fun! Highlight of our trip! Thanks!” B.A., Berkley, MI “My husband and I recently took a trolley tour in Nashville. Dunkin was our tour guide and he was wonderful. He was very knowledgeable and entertaining. He made the tour very enjoyable; we stayed on his trolley for the entire loop of the tour.” D.L. “To get away from the cold and snow of Michigan, my wife and I recently spent a few weeks meandering through Georgia, Florida and Tennessee. We went to Savannah first and the Visitor Center recommended taking an Old Town Trolley tour. It was the best thing we did as somebody who had never been to this beautiful and historic southern city. The guide was informative and entertaining and helped us see the highlights of Savannah and plan what we wanted to do once we got off the trolley. Our next stops were St. Augustine and Key West. We enjoyed the experience so much in Savannah that the first thing we did was get on your trolleys in both of these cities. While you are subject to the style and personality of the driver, and some were better than others, but on the whole, mostly good, the idea of seeing the highlights of a town before experiencing it on foot were well worth it each time. Our last stop was Nashville and, again, we learned a lot about the city through an Old Town Trolley before embarking on foot to get up close and personal. We didn’t plan on going to four cities where Old Town Trolley operates, but after the Savannah experience, we kept getting on your trolleys and can’t say enough about how good they were for setting the stage for an enjoyable experience after getting off. I don’t think we would have embraced each of the cities as much if we hadn’t taken an Old Town Trolley tour first. I just want to tell you how good we think your tours are and how much we enjoyed them. We will certainly recommend them to any of our friends.” P.F., Roselle, IL “I just wanted to let your company know how much my husband and I really enjoyed the Tour with “Patty”. She was so informative and funny! Can’t wait to tour other towns with your company!” B.M., New York, NY: “My colleague and I were recently in Nashville for a convention and we took a trolley tour with Randy. He was an excellent tour guide!! Very funny, had a terrific knowledge of the city, and he made the trip quite educational AND enjoyable. Thank you, Randy! And I’ll be sure to recommend Old Town Trolley Tours to anyone I know who visits Nashville .” K.W., Long Beach, NY: “Love the drivers!” Had several different drivers as we hopped on and hopped off… they were all equally awesome. They all knew the city and the history very well and were very funny and welcoming. Great way to explore Nashville especially when it’s hot and you don’t want to walk around all day. Highly recommend” R.C., Daytona Beach, FL: “We enjoyed the tour. Great information from guide. Very knowledgeable and great personality. We all had a fun tour as well.” K.K., Lambertville, MI: “Loved it! Learned so much about the city.” L.O., Hermon, ME: “A great service. Easily accessed guides were knowledgeable with a sense of humor. Answered all questions and gave us info on local eating establishments.” R.S., Newton, NJ: “An absolute must when one is new to a city and has no idea where to go and how to get there. This is my 3rd in this country and I have taken them overseas in Paris and London. Just wonderful!” facts facts toolbar Share: Email Print related articles related articles Up Up

post Awards and News toolbar Share: Email Print post intro Old Town Trolley Tours of Boston is proud to be recognized by these distinguished publications and organizations. post options post content Old Town Trolley of Boston Recognized by “One of the 10 best hop-on hop-off tours in the world.” Read more. Old Town Trolley of Boston Becomes a Member of the 100 Ton Club On October 22, 2009, Dennis K. Burke Inc. congratulated Old Town Trolley Tours of Boston in reaching a milestone and becoming a member of the “100 TON CLUB”. It is a very exclusive club with members that have reduced overall air pollutants by at least 100 tons. Old Town Trolley’s decision in 2006 to use Dennis K. Burke Inc. Patriot B5 bio diesel, low ash lube oil, as well as retrofit trolleys with catalectic converters have helped them reach this milestone. This was done at a time when no government mandates were in place and any additional cost factors were borne by Old Town Trolley. This fact alone speaks volumes about Old Town Trolley’s concern of Boston and fostering care of the environment. facts facts toolbar Share: Email Print related articles related articles Up Up

post Reasons To Visit St. Augustine $ toolbar Share: Email Print post intro THINKING ABOUT VISITING ST. AUGUSTINE? The beautiful coastal city of St. Augustine is home to pristine beaches and centuries of history, offering visitors a unique and unforgettable experience. Read on for the top reasons to visit St. Augustine, the oldest city in the United States. post options Admissions Shopping Dining Entertainment Restrooms post content Discover the magic of wintertime in St. Augustine and embark on a historical “Transportainment ® ” adventure! Ancient History St. Augustine is brimming with nearly 500 years of history . For those who wish to see it all and soak in as much of the city’s fascinating heritage as possible, a ride on the Old Town Trolley is a definite must do. The Old Town Trolley Tour takes you to all of the most important historic sights while allowing you to get off as often as you wish and spend as long as you want at each stop. There are 100 different points of interest on this comprehensive sightseeing tour including the Fountain of Youth , the City Gates , the Spanish Quarter , historic St. George Street , Castillo de San Marcos , Flagler Memorial Presbyterian Church , Grace United Methodist Church and so much more. Beaches A St. Augustine vacation has to include a day or two at one or more of the city’s beautiful beaches . There are various beaches to explore, each with its own majesty and personality. Crescent Beach offers a long, wide stretch of soft white sand, while Anastasia State Park provides a plethora of activities and adventure including swimming, windsurfing, paddle boarding, kayaking, canoeing and more. There are many more exquisite beaches in the area including South Ponte Vedra Beach, Vilano Beach, St. Augustine Beach and North Beach. Castillo de San Marcos One of the most significant historical structures in St. Augustine, Castillo de San Marcos is an awe-inspiring sight perched on the coast of the city. This massive fort was constructed by the Spanish between the years 1672 and 1695 and is the oldest masonry fortress in the United States. Constructed out of coquina, a form of limestone that was common in the area, the Castillo was used to protect the city from foreign invasions by sea. Today, visitors can tour the fort, walk through the hallways, see the walls that withstood many battles, witness canon firings and historical re-enactments and learn about the intriguing past of this imposing fortress. Henry Flagler Henry Flagler made his mark in St. Augustine as he did in many cities throughout Florida. It was his vision to create magnificent hotels that would draw in tourists from around the country to Florida. His influence remains throughout the city, including the Ponce de Leon Hotel, now Flagler College , and several other buildings such as the Lightner Museum and the City Hall complex. Flagler, who was more than a visionary, worked his way from poverty to prosperity, ambitiously developing the Florida East Coast Railroad, building churches and more. Today, a visit to St. Augustine treats you to a view of his extraordinary talents and golden touch. You can also visit the Memorial Presbyterian Church and Mausoleum where Flagler, his wife, daughter and granddaughter are buried. Sunshine and Blue Skies It is Florida after all! So if you need a reason to visit the gorgeous city of St. Augustine, how about the fact that the weather is nearly perfect all year round? During summer , you’ll enjoy warm and wonderful days for beach trips and for winter the weather is ideal for golf, relaxing, and touring the famous attractions. Great Golf For Miles Although Florida is known for having luxurious golf resorts throughout the state, you can only find the World Golf Village and Hall of Fame in St. Augustine. The museum has 2 golf courses nearby which offer impeccable conditions and challenges around every corner. In addition to the World Golf Village, you’ll also find 10 other golf courses in the immediate vicinity and over 50 within 50 miles of St. Augustine including the world-renowned TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach. St. Augustine Is Feeling The Love! Adam
Say hello to Conductor Adam, an ardent believer in faith and patriotism! Though he comes from the Windy City, Adam channels the same generous and compassionate energy as Nashville’s Tootsie Bess, the legendary proprietor of Tootsies Orchid Lounge. Conductor Adam is a talented multi-instrumentalist musician and you’re as likely to find him behind the wheel of a trolley as behind the church piano. With his unwavering dedication to his beliefs and community, Adam embodies the true spirit of Tootsie Bess in every way!
conductor
conductor info
Amber
Conductor Amber, from the charming town of Hohenwald, Tennessee, has a personality as expansive as her hometown’s countryside. With a passion for recognizing the value of hard work, she dreams of Employee Appreciation Month, a time when every hardworking individual could bask in well-deserved rest and recognition. Her fondest memories include her favorite people, her children. One memory that she holds dear is strolling hand in hand with her kids across the John Siegenthaler Pedestrian Bridge, where some of the most stunning views of the Nashville skyline can be found!
conductor
conductor info
Benji
Meet Conductor Benji, representing the Bluegrass State with a side of Nashville spice! His love for hidden gems like the Evans Grist Mill at Raven Run Nature Sanctuary shows his taste for adventure. When he’s not exploring out in nature or guiding tourists, you’ll find him vibing at the Farmers Market, soaking up the local fun and friendly atmosphere. He is a delightful soul; you’re in good hands with Benji!
conductor
conductor info
Bert
Introducing Bert (with an E!), our resident entertainer, keyboard player, and Night Tour driver. With a career entertaining on cruises and a lifetime devoted to songwriting, Bert brings a wealth of talent and warmth to every ride on our Night Tour. Despite his impressive musical journey, he remains a humble and friendly presence, delighting passengers with his piano skills and genuine kindness. Whether he’s behind the wheel or serenading guests with his timeless melodies, Bert is sure to make your journey through Nashville an unforgettable experience.
conductor
conductor info
Buck
Meet Buck, proudly representing Galveston, Texas, and harboring a deep appreciation for Nashville’s iconic Tootsies Orchid Lounge. When it comes to life advice, Buck’s philosophy is straightforward and succinct: don’t sweat the opinions of folks you wouldn’t take advice from. Buck dreams of mastering French one day to connect with his roots and his Louisiana kin.
conductor
conductor info
Collum
Meet Collum, our Lead Conductor and Script Trainer: a trivia whiz with a Shakespearian background! Hailing from Nashville, he’s all about giving our teachers the recognition they deserve – he’d even petition for a national holiday if he could. But nothing tops his Music City highlights quite like experiencing the mind-blowing 2017 Solar Eclipse. It was a moment that left him starstruck in more ways than one!
conductor
conductor info
Conner
Meet Conner, one of our delightful conductors here in Nashville. Married to a lovely sales rep, he’s one half of several husband-and-wife dynamics that make Old Town Trolley Tours feel like family. Known for his accepting nature and warm demeanor, Conner’s friendly presence adds a touch of joy to every ride. Whether he’s sharing stories or simply greeting passengers with a smile, Conner’s kindness shines bright, making him a cherished member of our team.
conductor
conductor info
Debbie
Presenting the extraordinary Cousin Debbie—our ultimate multitasker, juggling roles as Conductor, Concierge, and Trainer with effortless finesse! Hailing from Toledo, Ohio, she sprinkles Nashville with that special touch of home, making everyone feel like cherished family. If she could sit down with any historical figure, it would be Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Debbie would ask how he managed his emotions while facing down haters with grace. When she’s not busy spreading warmth, you’ll find Debbie cozying up in Alkebu-Lan Images Bookstore, Nashville’s best-kept secret and a haven for bibliophiles since ’86!
conductor
conductor info
Drey
Meet Drey, the reigning Conductor of the Year 2023, whose confidence and warm wit assure guests daily that they are in good hands. Hailing from rural Tennessee, Drey describes Music City as a place where people are driven by a kind of magic. Chasing rhinestone-studded dreams, people come from all over the world to Nashville to melt. The energy is palpable! With a pun-stoppable vivacious energy, Drey leads the Conductor pack with a commitment to historical accuracy and puns that hit harder than that Music City twang!
conductor
conductor info
Hunter
Meet Hunter, a Tennessee native, whose curiosity about history and adventure knows no bounds. He’s always wondered about Sacajawea’s brave journey into the unknown, leaving behind familiarity for the thrill of exploration. Hunter’s own adventures have taken him to awe-inspiring places, with Niagara Falls topping the list. And if you’re ever in town craving a quirky spot oozing with charm, Hunter suggests checking out Santa’s Pub for an unforgettable experience in Music City. You might meet Santa himself around the holidays!
conductor
conductor info
Hutch
Introducing Hutch, our resident historian’s historian. Hutch does two things: he drives a trolley, and he knows things. From military to sociological Nashville history, he’s the guy with all the answers. What truly sets him apart from the other members of Mensa is his blend of smarts and humility, making every ride with him a memorable one. Plus, with a spotless safety record, you’re in for a smooth and informative journey every time you hop aboard with Hutch!
conductor
conductor info
Jeff
Meet Conductor Jeff, affectionately known as Cornbread ’round these parts. He’s a true Southern gem with a heart as warm as a fresh batch of biscuits! To round out Cornbread’s Southern charm, his kindness knows no bounds, making him not just a great conductor but also a beloved friend to all who cross his path. So, hop aboard and let Cornbread guide you through Nashville’s streets with a smile and maybe even a tall tale or two along the way!
conductor
conductor info
Jim
Say hello to Conductor Jim, hailing from New England and now proudly calling Nashville home. Here, the rhythm of life harmonizes with his cheerful spirit. Amidst the bustling energy of Music City, Jim confesses a long-held desire to pick up the guitar, a dream tucked away amidst the responsibilities of adulthood (relatable). His golden nugget of wisdom is to read. Immerse yourself in the pages of a good book, for there’s no limit to the growth of the mind, and few things beat the serenity of a cozy reading session.
conductor
conductor info
Kyle
Meet Kyle, our Lead Conductor, who’s as cool as a cucumber and never takes things personally. Our Kyle comes complete with a heart full of kindness and a positively duck-like ability to let negativity roll off his back. When he’s not spreading good vibes on the trolley, you’ll likely find him at Nashville’s “Dawg House,” enjoying live music and cheap beer with friends. And while he may not be the handiest with engines, Kyle’s safety record driving is pristine, and his willingness to stay positive while trying new things just adds to his charm!
conductor
conductor info
Lance
Meet Conductor Lance, a proud Nashville native with a passion for the city’s rich history and landmarks. He believes these landmarks are not just about Nashville but integral to early American history, making them even more fascinating. Lance’s personal favorite is the LEED Gold certified Music City Center, a symbol of sustainability and culture, boasting a massive 2.1 million square feet, an energy-sustaining (and stunning!) three-acre green guitar-shaped roof, and over $5 million worth of art. With Lance as your guide, you’re guaranteed to discover the hidden treasures and smart insights that make Nashville truly special.
conductor
conductor info
Martel
Say hello to Martel, our Conductor who is known for his smooth rides. Originally from The ATL, Martel brings his unique flair to the streets of Nashville. He loves the city’s music, culture, and people, and if he could, he’d totally be He-Man in another timeline, keeping peace in Eternia… er, we mean Nashville with his powers!
conductor
conductor info
Owen
Say howdy to Conductor Owen, a Nashville native with a heart as big as the Grand Ole Opry stage! With a passion for Music City’s history and a knack for quirky, delightful storytelling, Owen will make you giggle like a cheerful banjo in a barn dance. From the Hermitage to Fort Negley, he’s full of contagious joy and endless jokes. Owen proves that growing up is optional, but being silly is mandatory!
conductor
conductor info
Rob
Meet Conductor Rob, a laid-back homebody who finds solace in his garage man cave rather than the bustling hubbub of the city nightlife. Curious by nature, he often wonders about early Nashville figures like Timothy Demonbreun and their experiences with Native Americans. Rob’s gentle spirit and genuine curiosity make him a friendly presence wherever he goes.
conductor
conductor info
Russell
Meet Russell, who believes that the flavor of Music City lies in its vibrant blend of food, music, and most importantly, its people. Originally from Maine, he’s fascinated by how these elements come together to create Nashville’s distinct essence. With a keen interest in history, particularly the golden age of piracy, Russell finds inspiration in the past that shapes his appreciation for the present and informs his mindful nature.

conductor
conductor info
Anthony “Tiger”
Having lived in and around Boston my entire life, I get the greatest joy from sharing my city with others. There is truly something for everyone here and I like sharing the hidden gems. I have been in the industry for 9 years, giving tours of Boston, Lexington, Concord, Salem, and the North Shore.
conductor
conductor info
Beanie
Head Conductor
Marisol “Beanie” has been with Old Town Trolley since 2001. She considers her hometown to be Boston, MA. While many people know she was adopted, what folks do not know is that she was found in a basket, all dressed in blue, on a doorstep, one summer evening back in 1980 in South America, when she was 2 years old.
conductor
conductor info
Becca
Becca, “Ginger,” has been a conductor at OTT since 2021 and is from Camden, Maine! After getting a bachelor’s in biology and learning to drive buses during her undergraduate studies, Becca worked in cancer research (she has been published in a cancer research journal!) until deciding to go to nursing school and starting at OTT. She is now working full-time as a nurse in a Boston hospital and is a Tour Conductor part-time because she missed sharing her love of Boston with her guests. In her free time Becca embroiders, solves Rubik’s cubes in less than a minute, lifts weights, rock climbs, enjoys a good nap, and avoids cardio workouts.

conductor info

I have 4 children and 3 grandchildren. I grew up in Roxbury; via Dorchester, now in Mattapan. Salvation Army seasonal worker (Thanksgiving and Christmas); Lyft/Uber Driver, Hospital Shuttle Driver. I enjoy volunteering, reading, singing, mac & cheese, and traveling.

conductor
conductor info
David “Cubbie”
Head Conductor
How long have you lived in Boston?
I was born at University Hospital and have spent my entire life inside Route 128
What is Boston’s best-kept secret?
The view of the city from Piers Park in East Boston
What is the one thing that you always carry with you?
A pocketknife. “Be Prepared”, you might have heard once or twice.
What is your favorite picnic area in Boston?
Not in the city. But it has a view of Boston. Buck’s Hill in the Blue Hills Reservation. Also, Boston Rock at Prospect Hill in Waltham.
Which author would write your life story?
I would have to go with Michael Crichton. The way my life story has played out, it can only be science fiction.
What was the best thing that happened to you at work?
Discovering that I actually have a talent for a job that I tried on a whim. Giving up a desk job to drive a trolley has been life-changing.
What’s your favorite movie about Boston/filmed in Boston?
I will go with the two that I am actually in. Field of Dreams (I was at Fenway) and Amazing Grace and Chuck (I was at the old Boston Garden)
What’s your secret talent that no one knows about?
I can write a Haiku on demand about virtually any subject. So quickly, that some of my friends have accused me of having a secret, online, “Haiku Generator.”

Laurent was born, raised, educated, and has lived all his life in Massachusetts. His favorite mode of recreational transportation is skis. He learned 3 decades ago, was immediately captivated, and almost just as immediately began teaching others the wonders of the sport and the mountain environment. In college philosophy class, he became enamored by the phrase Cogito Ergo Sum (I think therefore I am); however after he graduated college & began to ski, he realized his own personal motto might really be “I Ski Therefore I Am.” Laurent is now a Professional Ski Instructor Association (PSIA) Level 2 Certified Alpine Instructor at Blue Hills Boston where he has taught over 2,000 lesson hours to over 1,000 students, over the past 3 seasons.

She was born in Plymouth and raised in Hanover. Her family has lived in the same county of Massachusetts since 1620. Her roots in Massachusetts run deep, going from the Mayflower to the Salem Witch Trials. Ask her about it and she will talk your ear off.

My name is the Skipper. I grew up in Worcester, MA but have lived in Marblehead for over fifty years. I had a thirty-year career in the CAD/CAM industry, but since that devolved, I have had to reinvent myself; first as a salesman, then a professional ski instructor, a sail boat captain, a duck boat captain and now a trolley driver. I guess that is progress? I used to play squash and run, but my ortho guy won’t let me anymore. I guess it’s not bad being allowed to be lazy as I get older!

You know what they say: Boston: “you’re my home!” I am very friendly and love meeting new people! Hope to see you on my trolley!

Old Town Trolley Tours of St. Augustine Is recognized as a leader in reducing the nation’s dependence on imported oil through its commitment to advance transportation technologies and participation in the Clean Cities Program June 29, 2016 Historic Tours of America is Proud to Present Martin Luther King, Jr Bust to ACCORD Civil Rights Museum On April 4, 2016, Historic Tours of America was honored to present the ACCORD Civil Rights Museum of St. Augustine with a breathtaking bronze bust of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. The bust was expertly crafted by the HTA Art Department from the original MLK wax casting found at Potter’s Wax Museum. Taking part in this special event were St. Augustine Mayor Nancy Shaver, City Commissioner Todd Neville, Historian David Nolan, Katie Ross from Senator Bill Nelson’s office, and Assistant Superintendent of Schools, Martha Mickler. 2017 Best of St. Augustine Award Old Town Trolley is 2017 Best Guided Tour Old Town Trolley Tours is proud to be named 2017 Best Guided Tour by “Best of St. Augustine”. National Geographic Traveler recognizes St. Augustine in its annual list of the World’s 20 Must See Places National Geographic Traveler By Adam H. Graham December 2012 Florida’s fountain of youth History books taught us that Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León “discovered” Florida 500 years ago in 1513 while seeking the fabled fountain of youth . But before the peninsula was claimed by de León, it was home for more than 12,000 years to Paleo-Indians who built civilizations around its water-filled sinkholes and left behind archaeologically rich middens (giant piles of oyster shells) as proof of their bayside existence. Today, finding a genuine slice of “Old Florida” can be a scavenger hunt. The breezy Spanish colonial city of St. Augustine is an exception to the rule. A pair of marble lions greets visitors crossing the regal Bridge of Lions into the walled city. Looming over it is Castillo de San Marcos , a 17th-century fort surrounded by a moat and occupied at various times by Spanish, British, Confederate, and U.S. soldiers. The fort’s warren of chambers echoes with the stories of pirates, three signers of the Declaration of Independence, Spanish-American War deserters, and even Seminole Chief Osceola, who was incarcerated here in 1837 for leading the native resistance against the U.S. Along King Street sit historic Flagler College and the Lightner, an antiquities museum housed in an 1887 Spanish Renaissance Revival masterpiece. It was commissioned by oil tycoon Henry Flagler, who is credited with salvaging the city and planting Florida’s tourism seeds. St. George Street , St. Augustine’s main drag, may have become overly touristy and crowded with T-shirt emporiums and fudge shops, but the side streets still harbor scrubby garden courtyards and off-the-radar bars, such as the 130-year-old Mill Top Tavern, where you can imagine what Old Florida was like before it became the Sunshine State. How to Get Around The Old Town Trolley narrated tour route encompasses 22 hop-on and hop-off sightseeing stops, plus a free shuttle to the beach and Alligator Farm . Purchase passes online. Ponce de Leon treasures unveiled Historic City News June 7, 2010 Archaeologist Raphael A. Cosme told Historic City News local reporters that he is proud to announce a new exhibit has opened featuring his private collection of Spanish colonial artifacts at the St. Augustine History Museum. The exhibit entitled “Treasures of Juan Ponce de Leon and Domestic Life in Spanish Colonial St. Augustine” held its ribbon cutting ceremony before a crowd of spectators, including Cosme and his family, last Wednesday, June 2nd. Ed Swift IV, Director of Operations of Old Town Trolley Tours, presented Cosme with an award of recognition for his dedication to archaeology, for the discovery of Juan Ponce de Leon artifacts and for promoting and preserving Hispanic colonial folklore. Cosme has been researching and investigating Spanish colonial artifacts for the last 25 years. His finds include a comb carved out of bone, buttons, glass, coins dating from 1500 to 1630, cattle bones, and other inimitable pieces. “What makes this exhibit truly fascinating,” Cosme said, “is the fact that the site location of excavation could be the land boundary of Ponce de Leon’s temporary wooden house , which was built between 1519 and 1521.” The St. Augustine History Museum, located at 167 San Marco Avenue, features a combination of historical displays and private collections that bring over 400 years of Florida history to life. Cosme said that he is honored to have the opportunity to showcase his unique exhibit which is specifically intended to educate the general public on St. Augustine’s rich Spanish history. “Now the treasures of Juan Ponce de Leon will be accessible for public viewing. Old Town Trolley Wins Chamber of Commerce Member of the Year Award On October 22, 2009, Old Town Trolley Tours of St. Augustine was awarded Member of the Year at the St. Johns County Chamber of Commerce Annual Dinner, held at the beautiful Sawgrass Tournament Players Clubhouse in Ponte Vedra, Florida. Selected from 995 members, this was quite an honor, as it was presented in front of a large number of members. Mr. Don Wallis, Immediate Past Chair of the Chamber, made the presentation and thanked us for all of our help in the past several years with their Leadership St. Johns program for which we have provided transportation services. post Our Company toolbar Share: Email Print post intro OUR COMPANY HISTORY Chris Belland • Moe Mosher • Ed Swift In the early 1970’s, three friends came together in Key West, Florida, united by their passion for history and their desire to preserve the historic look and feel of Old Town Key West. Chris Belland, Ed Swift, and Moe Mosher first worked together restoring the historic storefronts of Duval Street in the heart of Key West. As visitors began to flock to Key West, there was an increased interest in the colorful history of the town. post options post content Recognizing this as an opportunity to tell Key West’s story, the three partners formed Old Town Trolley Tours, a tour company that both informs and entertains its guests. When Old Town Trolley Tours first started out, the company consisted of a converted bread truck with a homemade trailer. As the tours became more popular, the company was able buy a new fleet of trolleys, which was launched in 1980. Over the next year, more than 70,000 passengers toured Key West with Old Town Trolley. As Chris, Ed, and Moe traveled the country, admiring the architecture and history of many of America’s great cities, they were inspired to expand their business. Starting with Boston and eventually adding St. Augustine, San Diego, Savannah, Nashville, San Antonio, Washington, DC, and Charleston. Old Town Trolley Tours now boasts over 190 trolleys in 9 cities. Though the company has grown, its mission to help visitors “See the Best First” has stayed the same. Along with a commitment to quality, Old Town Trolley combines history, fun facts, colorful anecdotes, and outstanding service to provide their guests with a memorable vacation experience. Our Company Join “Join us in any of our great cities and see why our guests say we offer “the best sightseeing tours in the country!” facts facts toolbar Share: Email Print related articles related articles Up Up Our Company Join “Join us in any of our great cities and see why our guests say we offer “the best sightseeing tours in the country!”

post Environment toolbar Share: Email Print post intro OUR ENVIRONMENTAL COMMITMENT Old Town Trolley Tours has been going green since the 1980’s. With our use of clean burning propane, we’ve been committed to preserving and protecting the environment since we began delighting guests across the United States with our wonderful brand of Transportainment ® . post options post content WE’RE ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY Propane – the fuel of our fleets and the future We take our devotion to the environment so seriously that we converted 90% of our fleet to run on propane instead of gasoline. In fact, Old Town Trolley Tours was recently recognized by the Propane Industry with the Propane Exceptional Energy Fleet Award for our use of propane in our orange and green trolleys. Propane is a great alternative to gasoline because it burns cleaner, is safer, more cost effective and all around better for the environment. One trolley means less is more You may have noticed on the back of our trolleys the bumper sticker that reads “one trolley = 20 cars”. That’s because our trolleys not only offer people an entertaining, informative way to see cities across the country, they also reduce the amount of cars driving on the roads. And with fewer cars, there’s less pollution, a decrease in fuel consumption and less traffic. All of this makes a valuable impact on the environment. Today, tomorrow and beyond At Old Town Trolley Tours, we’re determined to do our part as a responsible corporate citizen to ensure the welfare of the environment. And our commitment is unwavering. Today and tomorrow and into the future, we plan on continuing with what we started over 30 years ago. That means that our company will consistently utilize new and innovative ways to improve the world we live in. So keep an eye out for our energy efficient, environmentally friendly trolleys and hop on board – they’re a breath of fresh air. Water-Soluble Guest Stickers We’re always looking for ways to be more environmentally friendly and reduce our impact on the communities we serve. That’s why we’re excited to implement water-soluble stickers for identifying our guests at our stops throughout the city. We understand that our guest stickers tend to end up where they don’t belong, so we wanted to invest in a more sustainable solution that aligns with our commitment to the environment. These stickers are not only useful for conductors to keep track of guests, but they also dissolve when exposed to water, preventing litter and keeping our cities green. Small actions like this can make a big difference on the planet, and we’re proud to set an example for all to follow! facts facts toolbar Share: Email Print related articles related articles Up Up

events intro nashville Events September Previous Next Scroll August October September event time title September 1, 2025 - September 30, 2025 Local Residents Ride Free Explore the city you call home with your friends! Davidson County residents can enjoy the Old Town Trolley tour for FREE when accompanied by a full fare adult paid guest with Hometown Pass. Go to Hometown Pass for more information. event time title September 5, 2025 - September 15, 2025 Nashville Fair The Fairgrounds Nashville, 625 Smith Ave. The Nashville Fair brings classic fairground fun to life with thrilling rides, tasty carnival food, and lively entertainment. Attendees can enjoy local exhibits, live music, and games, capturing the festive spirit of a traditional state fair with a touch of Nashville flair. event time title September 9, 2025 - September 13, 2025 AMERICANAFEST Various times and locations Every September, thousands of musicians, fans, and industry leaders descend upon Nashville for AMERICANAFEST, a celebration of Americana music that brings together some of the most talented and revered musicians in the genre. Hailed as “the coolest music scene today” by The New York Times, this premier event showcases a diverse array of musical styles, including folk, bluegrass, country, blues, and soul. If you want to experience the vibrant culture of one of the most musical cities in the world, join the 20,000 music lovers who will descend upon Music City at AMERICANAFEST. event time title September 13, 2025 Wine on the River Riverfront Park, 100 1st Ave. Wine on the River in Nashville is an annual event that combines the beauty of the Cumberland River with a delightful tasting experience. Attendees can sample an array of wines from around the world while enjoying the scenic riverside venue. In addition to wine tastings, the festival features local cuisine pairings and live music, enhancing the festive atmosphere. It’s the perfect event for wine lovers to explore diverse flavors and enjoy a memorable day out in the heart of Nashville. event time title September 13, 2025 Nashville Cocktail Festival East Park, 1700 Woodland St. The Nashville Cocktail Festival is a popular event celebrating the art and craft of cocktails. It brings together bartenders, spirit brands, industry professionals, and cocktail enthusiasts for a multi-day celebration that typically includes tastings, workshops, competitions, and themed parties. Attendees have the opportunity to learn about mixology, discover new brands and products, and enjoy expertly crafted drinks. The festival also features events hosted at different venues throughout Nashville, enhancing the city’s vibrant cocktail culture and community. event time title September 18, 2025 - September 24, 2025 Nashville Film Festival Various times and locations Hailed as one of the longest-running film festivals in the USA, the Nashville Film Festival in Nashville, Tennessee, attracts more than 40,000 movie lovers yearly. At this award-winning film festival in the culturally rich city of Nashville, you can fall in love with fresh, new musical scores, listen to an inspiring panel of filmmakers, and enjoy the magic of a hushed theatre buzzing with excitement. event time title September 19, 2025 African Street Festival Hadley Lillard Park, 1037 28th Ave. North The African Street Festival in Nashville is a vibrant three-day celebration of African culture, history, and music. This free festival features live performances, a bustling marketplace, and an immersive cultural experience that bridges the connection between Africa and Nashville. Held at Hadley-Lillard Park, the event offers a dynamic mix of art, cuisine, and community, creating a space for all to celebrate and explore African heritage. event time title September 20, 2025 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM InterNASHional Night Market Tennessee Immigrant and Refugee Rights Coalition, 3310 Ezell Road The InterNASHional Night Market in Nashville is a vibrant event celebrating the city’s diverse cultural heritage through food, music, and art. Local and international vendors gather to offer a wide array of global cuisines and handcrafted goods, creating a lively market atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy live performances and cultural displays, deepening their appreciation for Nashville’s multicultural community. The market provides a unique opportunity for cultural exchange and fosters a sense of unity among residents and visitors alike. event time title September 26, 2025 - September 28, 2025 Artville Walk of Fame Park, 121 4th Ave S. Artville Festival is a dynamic celebration that showcases a wide range of artistic expressions, including interactive installations, live performances, and collaborative workshops. It brings together local and international artists to create an immersive space where attendees can explore various art forms. The festival often partners with galleries and cultural institutions, providing educational opportunities through talks and workshops. Artville fosters a community of creativity, promoting artistic expression and cultural enrichment for all ages. event time title September 27, 2025 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM Kidsville Family Festival Centennial Park, 2500 West End Ave. The Kidsville Family Festival is a fun-filled event designed to entertain and engage children and their families with activities, games, and interactive performances. Located in a family-friendly venue, it features craft workshops, storytelling sessions, music, and more, providing an enriching environment for creativity and learning. It’s an ideal setting for families to bond and create lasting memories. post St. Augustine Customer Service (855) 245-8992 toolbar Share: Email Print post intro Need help? You’ve come to the right place. Find immediate answers to your questions in one of the categories below… or contact us directly. post options post content Top Questions How does the Old Town Trolley tour work? St. Augustine is a unique city filled with colonial Spanish neighborhoods, magnificent buildings and a charm all its own. The one hour tour features various stops where guests can get on and off to shop, dine or sightsee. We cover over 100 points of interest during our tour. Do I need a reservation? Our Old Town Trolley Tour boards approximately every 20-30 minutes and does not require a reservation. However, reservations are required for the following: Ghosts & Gravestones and Holiday Tour (Fast Track Pass); Reservation based tickets are non-refundable. You may reschedule up to 24 hours in advance of tour time. What age qualifies for a Child ticket? Old Town Trolley Tour: 4-12 years. Children under 4 ride free. Ghosts & Gravestones: 4-12 years. Children under 4 ride free. Can you accommodate handicapped passengers? Yes. Please phone in advance so that we may best accommodate you. Our toll free number is (844) 388-6452. How can I rent a Trolley for my group? The Old Town Trolley team, part of Historic Tours of America Group Sales office can give you information on groups and renting our vehicles for special events. They can be reached at (844) 388-6452. For small groups, our Internet discount may be the best option. Refunds How can I get a refund for my ticket? Please go to Refund information . I could not use my Ticket. What should I do? For guests who have purchased tickets directly from our website, we offer a Modify Booking Tool . Guests may change their reservation one time at no charge*. However, the guest is fully responsible if the fare price for the new date/time selected is more expensive. Refunds are not issued where ticket prices have decreased due to promotions or where the date/time selected is less expensive. Changes are subject to availability. Frequently Asked Questions Go to Frequently Asked Questions. Lost and Found To report a lost item or return an item you’ve found, please contact us at Lost and Found . Privacy Policy Go to Privacy Policy information . Website Terms of Use Go to Website Terms . Tour/Attraction Assistance (844) 388-6452 Write to Us: Historic Tours of America, Inc. Attn: Guest Relations 108 Sea Grove Main St., St. Augustine, FL 32080 facts facts toolbar Share: Email Print related articles related articles Up Up

Tony
Irenette
View All
conductor
conductor info
Tim
General Manager
Tim has worked for Old Town Trolley Tours (OTT) since 2013. He joined the cast then as a Ghost Actor/MOD. He fell in love with the character he developed within that role; that love quickly grew to the Boston operation as he moved into several different roles over the following years, ‘and the rest is history.’ Tim is ecstatic to be in his current role of always being “on stage” and is excited to help Boston operate at its fullest potential of being Boston’s ‘Storyteller.’ Tim lives in Arlington, MA with his wife and loves to spend time with her hiking in Vermont or walking the beaches of Maine.
conductor
conductor info
Agnes
Ghosts & Gravestones Gravedigger
When “Agnes” turned 30 in 1898, she knew the only way she could attain a marriage proposal was with academic achievements. Though her intelligence was lacking, she made up for it with bludgeoned professors and plagiarized papers. And it worked! A little too well… Now in death, Agnes is cursed to work in the least prestigious industry possible…ghost tourism. But hey, at least she is doing what she was so good at in life – taking other people’s stories and presenting them as her own!
conductor
conductor info
Alanna
Administrative Assistant
Alanna grew up in Lawrence, MA, and joined OTT as an administrative assistant in 2024. Alanna’s husband JD has driven for OTT since 2011, so she joined to see what all the fuss was about! Alanna is a dilettante in the silly arts: paint-by-numbers, standup comedy, and software development.
conductor
conductor info
Aldwin
Detailer
Born and raised in Port-Au-Prince, Haiti. I enjoy reading, watching sports, movies and I love classical music. I love apples, bananas, blueberries, potatoes, plantains, and yucca to name a few. My all-time favorite song is “We are the World” by USA for Africa.
conductor
conductor info
Allison
Sales Representative
Originally from Connecticut, Allison has lived in Salem Massachusetts, and moved to Boston in 2020. She has been at Old Town Trolley Boston since April 2023 and is currently a Sales Rep. She has worked in Salem as a walking tour guide and managed a museum and an aquarium gift shop.
conductor
conductor info
Amy “Mary”
Actor
Born and raised in Sonoma County, California, where I became a part of the chipping under the oakwood, the Northern California, Renaissance Faire. Then I moved to Alaska for four years before choosing New England as my home. My man and I live on a small farm where we raise silkie chickens. Our two goofball Roodles (half Rottweiler, half poodle) keep us safe from the encroaching hordes of squirrels.
conductor
conductor info
Andrew
Sales Representative
Andrew arrived on Old Town Trolley’s Doorstep in 2001! He had quit his boring job at Blockbuster Video to work as a Colonial Actor on The Boston Tea Party Ship. He eventually transferred to Sales at OTT, the job he has today. Andrew loves working with our CAST while selling our attractions to guests from around the world.
conductor
conductor info
Anesti
Detailer
Anesti came to Boston in 1996 with his family from Albania. He has two incredible children and a beautiful granddaughter named Paris. Anesti has been with HTA since 2001, working in our Maintenance Department – ensuring our trolleys are sparkling clean every day.
conductor
conductor info
Ariel
Sales Representative
Ariel is a creative person who likes to improvise and have fun. They have a very chipper personality and likes to greet others with a smile, willing to lend a hand to someone, if needed. A modern artist with colorful views and a fan of history as well as science. As they grow to become greater in their field of vision, they wish to one day get to see more of the world, other countries in which they meet people that come around on a daily basis. Someday, that dream will come true for them.
conductor
conductor info
Arthur
Ghosts & Gravestones Gravedigger
“Arthur Preston” was the dashing ringmaster of a stupendous traveling circus. But his career came to an untimely end when the cast of the Freak Show—performers who he’d personally mutilated and disfigured—broke free from their cages and took their revenge. Step right up, and maybe he will let you join the show.
conductor
conductor info
Aspen
Lead Actor
Aspen is a current resident of Gloucester, and has called nearly 5 different states home – but Massachusetts is truly where the heart is. Aspen has a beautiful wife, a wonderful daughter, and too many animals to count. (The cat, Spooky, is the favorite. Don’t tell the others.) When Aspen is not haunting the streets of Boston (or the local Taco Bell), you can find her occasionally hosting a karaoke night, attending a drag brunch, or as a practicing LMT. “Today I define success by the fluidity with which I transcend emotional land mines and choose joy and gratitude instead.” – RuPaul
conductor
conductor info
Atticus
Ghosts & Gravestones Gravedigger
“Doctor Atticus Nobody” was a prodigiously renowned physician and alchemical scholar, who became infamous for his morally dubious research. His quest for immortality ended with tragic results, trapping him in a flawed immortal body plagued by hellish visions upon each consecutive demise. This perpetual cycle has come at the cost of both sanity and surname, rendering him both mad and predisposed to work in tourism.
conductor
conductor info
Attucks
Sales Representative
Hi, my name is Attucks. I am from Lisbon, Portugal. I moved to Boston years ago. I love our amazing city and spend a lot a time navigating and discovering more about it. I am currently concentrating on finally going back to college and finishing my Psychology degree. I have worked as a Dunkin Donuts Store Manager, an Interpreter, and I am loving working for Old Town Trolley Tours. I love sports and love learning new things. Something fun about me is that I can enjoy Eros Ramazzotti the same way I would enjoy Drake. I just love music.
conductor
conductor info
Balthazar
Fleet Mechanic
Born and raised in Boston. I always have my cell phone and a chapStick in my pocket. I enjoy a great picnic by the water where I envision the author Robert Greene would write my life story. What is Boston’s best-kept secret? Most don’t know that Fenway grows its own vegetables. That is an innovative way to use 1800 sq. feet of dead space. Fenway Farms supplies produce for EMC level.
conductor
conductor info
Beth
Vendor Sales Representative
Beth started at Old Town Trolley Tours of Boston as a conductor in 2004. Later that year, she moved into the Vendor Sales Representative position. She is proud to work for a company that is so well respected and represented in the tour industry. In her free time, she enjoys watching her kids’ soccer matches and taking long walks with her husband and their dog.
conductor
conductor info
Bob
Commercial Fleet Manager
Bob has been an ASE Master Technician since the age of 18. He worked most of his life as a flat-rate mechanic for Oldsmobile & Chevrolet dealerships. He came to OTT in 2005 and heads up our maintenance and mechanical departments.
conductor
conductor info
Charlize
Actor
Hey I’m Charlize! I use they/them pronouns and am from Ipswich, Massachusetts, though now residing in the Boston area for school! I’m a musical theater major at the Boston Conservatory at Berklee and am currently in my junior year. I’m currently trying to become a puppeteer because I grew up watching so many tv shows as a kid that were FILLED with puppets (i.e., Between the Lions, Bear in the Big Blue House, The Muppets, Sesame Street, etc.). And a fun fact is that I have hidden multiple cardboard cut outs throughout my apartment for people to find; my favorite is the large Tinky Winky head 🙂
conductor
conductor info
Chris
Lead Detailer
Music lover, I work as a radio DJ & also as a mobile DJ for various events. Huge sports fan and animal lover. Love football, baseball or going to a good metal or rock concert. I also enjoy relaxing with some video games or playing my guitar.
conductor
conductor info
Chris C
Sales Representative
From Charlestown, MA. An OTT sales rep, hired in 2010 and again in 2019. Studied Car Design in San Francisco and in Los Angeles, California. Chris is currently pursuing music, specifically percussion.
conductor
conductor info
Darren
Sales Representative
Darren has lived in Cambridge, MA for the past 4 years. Originally from Virginia Beach, VA. Boston’s Best Kept Secret: Samuel Adams Brewery and the Seaport District, lived there for a year. The Brightest Smile of Boston, former Multimedia Journalist for various news outlets across the country.
conductor
conductor info
David J
Manager Trainee
David moved to Massachusetts back in 2022 so he could spend more time with his family and friends. This led him to finding the perfect fit with Old Town Trolley Tours in January of 2024. Although David is not a Boston native, he always enjoyed stopping here each summer on the way up to his family’s Lake House in Sebago, Maine. Every year he would learn something new about the city and believes that Boston is one of the most unique cities in America. David is proud to be part of the OTT CAST here in Boston and is excited about what the future holds here at Historic Tours of America.
conductor
conductor info
Derek
Sales Representative
As an Old Town Trolley Sales Representative, I enjoy connecting with our valued customers on a personal level. In this way I am helping to create lasting and positive vacation memories. Boston as a city has been on my radar, so to speak, since the age of ten when I became an avid hockey, specifically Bruins, fan. I am grateful to be part of a dynamic company living in the city of my hockey dreams!
conductor
conductor info
Dottie
Ghosts & Gravestones Gravedigger
“Dottie Mayhem” (1800-1826) was a cautionary tale for giving people in high offices the benefit of the doubt. She was very unlike a beach ball, in that when you push a beach ball out a window, it will just bounce, instead of die. Also, very unlike a beach ball, she returned from the grave a murderous revenant with a penchant for all things eerie, unsettling, and absurd.
conductor
conductor info
Evelyn
Ghosts & Gravestones Gravedigger
Evelyn Row is a talented stage actress and serial killer from the late 1800s, but she does not look a day over 148. She loves entertaining and horrifying audiences so much, she sold her soul to the devil so she could perform forever. Her hobbies include collecting dead body parts, dancing with skeletons, and hypnotizing people with songs.
conductor
conductor info
Gordon “Gordie”
Maintenance Manager
Raised in the Jersey fens to the strains of Tom Lehrer and Belafonte, and nurtured among the dewy, firefly-strewn suburban lawns of the American south, Gordie has been a resident of New England for nearly half his life. He lives in Allston, the “City of Kings,” with his delightful partner and pal, Colette… and Shorpy, the cat. Gordie will be forever grateful to Old Town Trolley for releasing his inner tour guide, an entity whose existence he never suspected. Like a mastodon bellowing across primeval swamps, he hopes to share his love of this corner of America with our visitors to Boston.
conductor
conductor info
Greaves Hermosa
Actor
Being a graveyard-bound pirate wasn’t what I had in mind when I was in school for graphic design and marketing, and while working as a waitress in Hampton, NH. I love learning. I’m getting good at stuff without worldly appreciation, trying things that scare me – and learning to be a good person. From pro wrestling to piracy, I’ve always done one thing well, diving in head first and doing my best!
conductor
conductor info
Grogan
Marketing Coordinator
Grogan has worked for Old Town Trolley since 2021, beginning their career humbly as the undead pirate captain “Greaves Hermosa” with Ghosts & Gravestones. After setting sail back to the land of the living, Grogan moved into the role of Marketing Coordinator in 2023, creating graphics and handling media.
conductor
conductor info
Harlan
Ghosts & Gravestones Gravedigger
“Harlan Hayvrast” was condemned to a life of tourism in 1797. His actor, Derek, has fulfilled the role for OTT since 2019. Always on the stage to elevate the guest’s experience. Stay vertical.
conductor
conductor info
Jeff
I have lived in Hyde Park, MA since 1995. I’m a huge Boston sports fan. In fact, I have a Red Sox tattoo on my right arm. I have been in the trolley tour business since 1999. I also have two brothers; one older in Colorado and one younger, who just had twin boys.
conductor
conductor info
Jennifer
Sales Representative

conductor
conductor info
Stephen
Concierge
Stephen grew up in Boston, just beyond the North End. When he was a kid, one of his favorites, almost daily excursions, was to hop on the “T” after school and go on explorations all over the city with his friends. With a life-long knowledge of the city and its history, when the Concierge position opened-up at Old Town Trolley to serve at the Marriott Long Wharf Hotel, he was eager to sign on. Sharing knowledge of the city, informing guests of tours and cultural attractions, while guiding them to some of Boston’s finest restaurants, is enjoyable and fun. Stephen most likes the diversity of guests who visit the city from across the country and from every nation around the world. When people ask him what he does for a living, he jokingly replies, “I get to tell people where to go and what to do, which pretty much sums up this role, which I enjoy very much.”

conductor info
Steven
Tour Entertainment Manager
Steven currently oversees The Sons and Daughters of Liberty Educational Tour and his one-true-love – Ghosts & Gravestones of Boston. After a stunning, high-profile career of performing in such theater destinations as Kittery, Maine and Portsmouth, NH, Steven left for the small, little known town of Boston, MA to teach the local actors how it was done. In his spare time, Steven enjoys film, boxing, running, board games, reading, role-playing games, hiking, Star Trek, comic books, performing at Improv Boston, traveling and all things to do with horror and Halloween. He recently earned a degree in Sociology at the University of Massachusetts, Boston.

She was born in the City of Boston and grew up in the City of Somerville right next door and has never lived further than 20 miles from Boston. She is a Colonial/American Revolution Reenactor and can cook over fire for 20 or 30 people. Come and let her show you around Boston.
conductor
conductor info
Tracey
HR Manager
I was born and brought-up in Boston. Some of my best childhood memories were in the North End, visiting family, enjoying gravy on our macaroni on Sundays, getting a single purple balloon at the weekly Summer Feasts, and eating entirely too much of the original East Coast favorite, Ritchie’s Slush.
I have worked in several industries over my 30 or so years of experience. Corporate America was no longer challenging (or fun) for me. In researching other job opportunities, I came across the HR Manager position ad for Old Town Trolley Tours of Boston. After reading all the wonderful write-ups and bios, I knew it would be a positive change if I was able to work here. I applied for the position, and the rest is history!
